page.title: 07HUDDERSFIELD ROYAL INFIRMARY
page.content: The Infirmary was opened in 1963 in place of the old infirmary in New North Road. It covers 23 acres of ground. It employes 13OO staff excluding 6O students, medical doctors and 4O consultants. There are 534 beds and 22 wards in the buildings. There are also 9 theatres. Since the closing down of the Princess Royal Maternity Hospital, the Infirmary has had alterations and extensions to extend their maternity building and all maternity cases now go to the Infirmary. It also has a new maternity outpatients clinic. It is the largest of seven hospitals in the Huddersfield area and the only one to receive accidents and emergencies.
